name: Sociolinguistics and Second Language Teaching and Learning
description: This course considers the impact on variant use by second language learners exerted by linguistic and extra-linguistic factors, such as the surrounding linguistic context, age, sex, style, and curricular and extra-curricular exposure. Implications are drawn for second language teaching, including deciding what registers and variants to teach and what activities to employ. Students enrolled in this course who submit all written work in the language they are studying (French/Italian) may petition the department for credit towards a Specialist (French or Italian) or Major (French/Italian). [24L]
